intro: Cheirodendron trigynum subsp. trigynum, commonly known as the three-stigma sycamore, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces a distinctive, fleshy capsule as its fruit. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid climates.
